intro: Digomphotis, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
